## Description {#details}

The possible results of an alias query.

These results are always computed between two <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> objects as a query to some alias analysis.

Note that these are unscoped enumerations because we would like to support implicitly testing a result for the existence of any possible aliasing with a conversion to bool, but an &quot;enum class&quot; doesn&#39;t support this. The canonical names from the literature are suffixed and unique anyways, and so they serve as global constants in LLVM for these results.

See docs/AliasAnalysis.html for more information on the specific meanings of these values.

Definition at line 77 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>.

## Enumerations

### enum  {#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>enum llvm::AliasResult::Kind : uint8&#95;t</>}>

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a863ee317b92588eb2d6878af9fc98922" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NoAlias">
The two locations do not alias at all (= 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a0916b614598c673c1e6a59c7312a1409" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MayAlias">
The two locations may or may not alias
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a9e724bc94de38c6ca77508f19c246c0c" />
<EnumerationListItem name="PartialAlias">
The two locations alias, but only due to a partial overlap
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57ac1a99a1af9a4778a61e5cc3e1d622180" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MustAlias">
The two locations precisely alias each other
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>
